publication.title: New promoter mutations in the low-density lipoprotein receptor gene which induce familial hypercholesterolaemia phenotype: molecular and functional analysis

mutation.metadata: Adult heterozygous familial hypercholesterolaemia (FH) individuals have a markedly raised plasma cholesterol that is associated with accelerated atherosclerosis and premature coronary heart disease. Molecular screening in an indifivial with FH revealed a promoter mutation -60C>T in the conserved nucleotide sequence of the sterol-dependent regulation element repeat 2. BLAT analysis of the sequence in Figure 1 places the mutation at chr19:11200072C>T. No detailed phenotype information is provided. No experimental confirmation is provided, but the mutation is noted to affect a known sterol-dependent regulation element repeat.
